meta.name: Generate AI-Powered Images using IBM Granite Vision 3.3 2B with Replicate

assignments.name: response
assignments.value: ={{ { success: true, image_url: $json.output, prediction_id: $json.id, status: $json.status, message: 'Image generated successfully' } }}

assignments.name: response
assignments.value: ={{ { success: false, error: $json.error || 'Image generation failed', prediction_id: $json.id, status: $json.status, message: 'Failed to generate image' } }}

parameters.content:
=======================================
        GRANITE-VISION-3.3-2B GENERATOR
=======================================
For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos

=======================================

## ðŸ¤– **IBM-GRANITE/GRANITE-VISION-3.3-2B - IMAGE GENERATION WORKFLOW**

**ðŸ”¥ Powered by Replicate API and n8n Automation**

---

### ðŸ“ **Model Overview**

- **Owner**: ibm-granite
- **Model**: granite-vision-3.3-2b
- **Type**: Image Generation
- **API Endpoint**: https://api.replicate.com/v1/predictions

**ðŸŽ¯ What This Model Does:**
Granite-vision-3.3-2b is a compact and efficient vision-language model, specifically designed for visual document understanding, enabling automated content extraction from tables, charts, infographics, plots, diagrams, and more.

---

### ðŸ“‹ **Parameter Reference**

**ðŸ”´ Required Parameters:** None
**ðŸ”µ Optional Parameters:** seed, image, top_k, top_p, images, prompt, max_tokens, min_tokens (and 6 more)

**ðŸ“– Detailed Parameter Guide:**
- **seed** (integer): Random seed. Leave blank to randomize the seed.
- **image** (string): Deprecated single image input.Use images input instead.Ignored if images used.
- **top_k** (integer): The number of highest probability tokens to consider for generating the output. If > 0, only keep... (Default: 50)
- **top_p** (number): A probability threshold for generating the output. If < 1.0, only keep the top tokens with cumula... (Default: 0.9)
- **images** (array): Image inputs for the model.
- **prompt** (string): User prompt to send to the model. (Default: )
- **max_tokens** (integer): The maximum number of tokens the model should generate as output. (Default: 512)
- **min_tokens** (integer): The minimum number of tokens the model should generate as output. (Default: 0)
- *...and 6 more parameters*

---

### ðŸ”§ **Workflow Components Explained**

**ðŸŽ¯ Manual Trigger**
- Starts the workflow execution
- Click to begin image generation process

**ðŸ” Set API Token** 
- Configures your Replicate API authentication
- Replace 'YOUR_REPLICATE_API_TOKEN' with your actual token
- Essential for accessing the ibm-granite/granite-vision-3.3-2b model

**âš™ï¸ Set Image Parameters**
- Configures all input parameters for the model
- Includes both required and optional parameters
- Pre-filled with sensible defaults for testing

**ðŸš€ Create Image Prediction**
- Sends the generation request to Replicate API
- Uses the image parameters you configured
- Returns a prediction ID for status tracking

**â³ Wait & Status Checking Loop**
- Waits 5 seconds then checks prediction status
- Continues checking until completion or failure
- Implements intelligent retry logic with 10-second delays

**âœ… Success/Error Handling**
- Routes successful completions to success response
- Handles failures gracefully with error details
- Returns structured JSON response with URLs/errors

**ðŸ“Š Logging & Monitoring**
- Logs all requests for debugging and monitoring
- Tracks timestamps and prediction IDs
- Helps identify issues during development

---

### ðŸŒŸ **Key Benefits**

- **ðŸŽ¨ Instant Image Generation**: Transform ideas into images using state-of-the-art AI
- **ðŸ”„ Automated Workflow**: Handles the complete generation pipeline automatically
- **ðŸ›¡ï¸ Error Resilience**: Built-in retry logic and comprehensive error handling
- **ðŸ“ˆ Production Ready**: Includes logging, monitoring, and structured responses
- **ðŸ”§ Customizable**: Easy to modify parameters and extend functionality
- **âš¡ Efficient Processing**: Optimized API calls with intelligent status checking

---

### ðŸš€ **Quick Start Instructions**

1. **ðŸ”‘ Get Your API Key**
   - Sign up at https://replicate.com
   - Navigate to your account settings
   - Copy your API token

2. **ðŸ”§ Configure the Workflow**
   - Replace 'YOUR_REPLICATE_API_TOKEN' with your actual token
   - Adjust parameters in the 'Set Image Parameters' node
   - Customize the prompt or other inputs as needed

3. **â–¶ï¸ Execute the Workflow**
   - Click the 'Manual Trigger' to start
   - Monitor the execution in the n8n interface
   - Check logs for detailed execution information

4. **ðŸ“¥ Get Your Results**
   - Successful generations return a URL to your image
   - Download or use the generated content as needed
   - Results are available immediately upon completion

---

### ðŸ” **Troubleshooting Guide**

**Common Issues:**
- **Invalid API Token**: Ensure your Replicate token is valid and has sufficient credits
- **Parameter Validation**: Check that required parameters match expected types
- **Generation Timeout**: Some images take longer - monitor the logs
- **Output Format**: Verify the model returns the expected output format

**Best Practices:**
- Test with default parameters first
- Monitor your Replicate usage and billing
- Keep API tokens secure and never commit them to code
- Use appropriate parameter values for your use case

---

**ðŸ”— Additional Resources:**
- Model Documentation: https://replicate.com/ibm-granite/granite-vision-3.3-2b
- Replicate API Docs: https://replicate.com/docs
- n8n Documentation: https://docs.n8n.io

---
